The shopping cart page should provide a clear and organized summary of all items selected for purchase. At the top, it should display a concise overview of the total number of items and the overall cost, including any applicable taxes and shipping fees. Each product in the cart should be listed with a thumbnail image, brief description, quantity selector, and individual price. Users should have the ability to easily update quantities or remove items. The page should also feature options to apply discount codes or gift cards and provide a detailed breakdown of costs. Prominent buttons for proceeding to checkout and continuing shopping should be readily accessible. Additionally, the cart page should offer an option to save items for later, ensuring a smooth transition between shopping and checkout while enhancing the overall user experience.

This is an example catalog page. The catalog page of a your mobile app should offer a seamless and engaging shopping experience. At the top, it should feature a search bar for easy product or category lookup, alongside filter and sort options to refine search results by attributes such as price, popularity, or new arrivals. The page should prominently display product categories with intuitive icons or images, and showcase featured products through high-quality visuals and brief descriptions. Users should be able to view products in a grid or list format, with options for quick previews and detailed views. Additional elements include promotional banners for special offers, user reviews and ratings to guide purchase decisions, and easy access to the cart and wishlist. To enhance usability, the page should support personalization features, such as product recommendations, and include accessibility options like text size adjustment and high contrast mode. Interactive features like product zoom and 360-degree views can further enrich the user experience.
